schema.name: mAdminState
schema.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
schema.label: Enable administrative state
schema.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
schema.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

schema.name: Filename
schema.summary: Name of the file that contains the private key
schema.description: <p>Specifies the file that contains the private key. This name might be the same as the file that contains the public key. You can specify a local private key file, a remote z/OS private key file, or a SafeNet Luna key file.</p><ul><li>For a local key file, access a list of files that are contained in the <tt>cert:</tt> or <tt>local:</tt> directory, and select the file that contains the private key aliased by this key object. <p><b>Attention:</b> Any file in the <tt>local:</tt> directory can be downloaded or included in an export. Therefore, consider carefully before you store cryptographic files in this directory.</p></li><li>For a remote z/OS key file, specify the location and the file name. <ol><li>Select <tt>saf-key://</tt> or <tt>saf-remote-key://</tt> from the list of directories. <p>A <tt>saf-key://</tt> must be a SAF key that is not stored in ICSF. A <tt>saf-remote-key://</tt> must be a SAF key that is stored in ICSF.</p></li><li>Enter the label name of an existing SAF key residing on the z/OS system using the form <tt><i>nssclient/ZOSKEYLABEL</i></tt> where <i>nssclient</i> is an existing NSS client.</li></ol><p>See the z/OS Communications Server: IP Configuration Guide for details on label names.</p></li><li>For a remote key file on the SafeNet Luna Network HSM, specify the location and the file name. The DataPower Gateway supports keys that are generated on only the the Luna HSM. <ol><li>Select <tt>luna-remote-key://</tt> from the list of directories.</li><li>Enter the file name in one of the following formats based on whether the key is part of a high availability (HA) group. <ul><li>When part of an HA group, use the <tt><i>group/label</i></tt> format.</li><li>When not part of an HA group, use the <tt><i>partition/label</i></tt> format. <p>where, <ul><li><i>group</i> indicates the configuration name of the HA group that contains the key.</li><li><i>partition</i> indicates the configuration name of the partition that contains the key.</li><li><i>label</i> indicates the label name of the private key on the HSM. The label name of the private key is specified by the <tt>labelPrivate</tt> parameter when you generate the key with the Luna <tt>cmu generatekeypair</tt> command on the Luna HSM.</li></ul></p></li></ul></li></ol><p>The DataPower Gateway communicates with the Luna HSM appliance through the SafeNet Luna HSM configuration. To use a private key on the HSM, the SafeNet Luna HSM configuration must be defined and in the <tt>up</tt> operational state. The key must be stored in a partition or an HA group that the DataPower Gateway can access. Therefore, the partition or HA group configuration must be in the <tt>up</tt> operational state.</p></li></ul>
A cleartext password required to access the file containing the private key.
schema.name: Password

schema.description: The password alias of a cleartext password required to access the file containing the private key.
schema.summary: The alias of the password required to access the file containing the private key.
schema.name: Alias
